title: The Launch: Fashion News to Know This April
excerpt: Plus, more fashion news to know (and shop) this month.
text: No April Fools’ Day jokes here: This month will be full of drops, collaborations, and openings that will set your spring wardrobe up for success. First up, Coach has announced a long-term partnership as the official handbag of the WNBA; plus, Staud and St. Regis’s new collaboration will put you in a tropical mood. For all the fashion news to know this April, we’ve got you covered, below.Courtesy of CoachWho: Coach and the WNBAWhat: Official handbag partner of the league Where: Online at coach.comWhy: Coach is now the official handbag of the WNBA. To kick off the multi-year partnership, WNBA rookies will walk the Orange Carpet presented by Coach. Focusing on highlighting outstanding athleticism and sportsmanship, the brand will spotlight five inspiring draftees. Beyond the draft, Coach will also collaborate on major league moments including Pride Month and All-Star Weekend. Coach Tabby Shoulder Bag 26Coach Chain Tabby Shoulder BagCoach Tabby Shoulder Bag 20Dries Van Noten Opens Its First New York City FlagshipTijs Vervecken / Courtesy of Dries Van NotenWho: Dries Van NotenWhat: New flagshipWhere: Soho, New York CityWhy: Dries Van Noten has opened its first stand-alone New York store in the heart of Soho. The flagship is directly inspired by the Manhattan streets, blending fast-paced energy with house codes to craft an immersive narrative experience that features design pieces by Ben Storms and artwork by Simone Crestani. A full selection of womenswear, menswear, and accessories are available to shop at the boutique now. Dries Van Noten Embellished JacketDries Van Noten Silk Lace TopDries Van Noten Embellished Jacquard SkirtTory Burch Brought Back the Reva Ballerina FlatsJohn Yuyi / Courtesy of SsenseWho: Tory BurchWhat: Reva ballerina flatWhere: Online at ssense.com Why: Landing straight from the spring/summer 2025 runway, Tory Burch is back with its iconic Reva ballerina flat. Much to the dismay of die-hard Tory fans, the shoe had previously been out of production since 2017. The hiatus inevitably rebuilt the style’s allure, and now, the flat is back with revamped beveled logo hardware and an all-new mule iteration. Tory Burch Reva Ballerina FlatsTory Burch Reva Ballerina FlatsTory Burch Reva Backless Ballerina FlatsStaud Teamed Up With St. Regis on a Vacation-Themed CollaborationCourtesy of Staud and St. Regis Hotels & ResortsWho: StaudWhat: Collaboration with St. Regis Hotels & ResortsWhere: Online at stregisboutique.com and staud.clothingWhy: Your vacation wardrobe should help you look exactly how you feel. For its first hospitality partnership, Staud has teamed up with St. Regis Hotels & Resorts to create a collection that will always remind you of your time in the sand. The signature Tommy bag, Moon bag, Squillo tote, and Meyers crochet bucket hat have been reimagined in raffia and a new beaded print exclusive to St. Regis.Staud x St. Regis Moon ToteStaud x St. Regis Tommy Beaded BagStaud x St. Regis Squillo Raffia ToteAnna Sui Is Staging an Archival Exhibition at the Phoenix Art MuseumCourtesy of Phoenix Art MuseumWho: Anna SuiWhat: “The World of Anna Sui” exhibitionWhere: The Phoenix Art Museum in PhoenixWhy: Traveling all the way from the Fashion and Textile Museum in London, “The World of Anna Sui” is landing at the Phoenix Art Museum (PhxArt). Since her runway debut in 1991, Sui is easily recognizable for her runways filled with supermodels decked out in her signature new-grunge aesthetic. The exhibit showcases more than 100 ensembles, including contemporary seasons, personal archive pieces, and looks curated in partnership with the museum’s fashion collection. Balenciaga and Scholl Revamp the Summer MuleCourtesy of BalenciagaWho: Balenciaga and Scholl What: Capsule collectionWhere: Online at balenciaga.com Why: Comfort meets design in Balenciaga’s latest footwear collaboration with Scholl. Originally debuting on the brand’s fall/winter 2025 runway during Paris Fashion Week, each style blends Demna’s subtle subversions with Scholl’s orthopedic insoles. The collection includes a knee-high boot, a clog mule, and heeled and flat sandals that nod to the original 1956 Pescura design. Balenciaga x Scholl Clog MuleBalenciaga x Scholl Flat SandalBalenciaga x Scholl SandalModa Operandi Brings a Curated Shopping Experience to Palm BeachGabrielle Wilde / Courtesy of Moda OperandiWho: Moda Operandi What: Curated shopping experienceWhere: The Brazilian Court Hotel in Palm Beach, FloridaWhy: Moda Operandi is bringing its luxury shopping expertise to Palm Beach. Until April 12, you can shop a curated selection of the e-tailer’s brands at The Brazilian Court Hotel. The week of shopping will include exclusive edits from brands like Johanna Ortiz, Brandon Maxwell, Missoni, and more. Guests are also welcome to peruse a variety of immersive experiences featuring Maison d’Etto, Sauer Fine Jewelry, and TWP. Johanna Ortiz Alcázar Natural Palm Mini Tote BagCredit: Moda Operandi, Inc.Missoni Knit Cover Up Mini DressCredit: Moda Operandi, Inc.Brandon Maxwell Gage Tailored Velvet Denim JacketBuccellati Stages a Milan Design Week ExperienceCourtesy of Buccellati Who: BuccellatiWhat: “Naturalia” exhibit Where: Milan Design WeekWhy: This Milan Design Week, enter Buccellati’s fantastical world of nature and craft. Formed in partnership with Balich Wonder Studio, “Naturalia” is an immersive experience that guides you through silver pieces from the brand’s Furry Animals, Nature, and Marina collections. Natural scenes have been seamlessly integrated with digital displays to highlight the complex craft of each piece. Buccellati Three Vine LeavesBuccellati Furry HawkBuccellati Charonia Tritonis Shell Mercedes-Benz, Moncler, and Nigo Debut G-Class-Inspired Capsule CollectionThibaut Grevet / Courtesy of Mercedes-BenzWho: Mercedes-Benz x Moncler by NigoWhat: Capsule collection Where: Online at moncler.comWhy: Combining brand legacy with contemporary streetwear, Mercedes-Benz, Moncler, and Nigo have collaborated on capsule collection that honors the Kenzo creative director’s one-of-a-kind Project G-Class Past II Future art piece. The pieces, which are part of the Moncler Genius roster, are inspired by Nigo’s influential streetwear career. Dual-logo baseball caps, oversized graphic T-shirts, and old-school bomber jackets draw on classic ’90s hip-hop silhouettes. Starting April 18, customers will also have the chance to pre-order a Hot Wheels replica of the Project G-Class Past II Future car model from mattelcreations.com. Moncler x Mercedes-Benz by Nigo T-ShirtMoncler x Mercedes-Benz by Nigo Baseball CapMoncler x Mercedes-Benz by Nigo Anubis Packable Jacket Marni and Hoka Release The Bondi B3LS Running SneakerGabriele Rosati / Courtesy of MarniWho: Marni and HokaWhat: Bondi B3LS Running SneakerWhere: Online at Marni.com, Hoka.com, flagship boutiques, and select global retailersWhy: Marni and Hoka have teamed up to release this season’s coolest running sneaker that celebrates movement and style. The Bondi B3LS Running Sneaker combines Marni’s signature color play with Hoka’s powerful performance. Featuring a bold, monochromatic silhouette, the sneakers are available in red, blue, brown, and yellow. Marni Yellow MARNI x HOKA Bondi B3LS SneakerMarni Red MARNI x HOKA Bondi B3LS SneakerMarni Blue MARNI x HOKA Bondi B3LS SneakerDuran Lantink Wins This Year's International Woolmark PrizePeter White//Getty ImagesWho: Duran LantinkWhat: International Woolmark Prize Where: Milan, ItalyWhy: Duran Lantink has been awarded this year’s International Woolmark Prize. Presented by Donatella Versace, the independent designer will receive a cash prize of $300,000 AUD (approximately $195,000). Lantink, who made waves this Paris Fashion Week with his viral breastplate runway look, is also reported to be Jean Paul Gaultier's next couture guest designer. LVMH Announces 2025 Finalists Courtesy of Francesco MuranoWho: Alainpaul, All-In, Francesco Murano, Soshiotsuki, Steve O Smith, Tolu Coker, Torishéju, and ZomerWhat: LVMH announces eight finalists for the 2025 LVMH PrizeWhere: Paris, FranceWhy: After months of deliberation, LVMH has announced the eight finalists for this year’s LVMH Prize. On July 3, the short-listed independent designers will present in front of the jury for a chance to secure a €400,000 endowment and tailored mentorship program led by the LVMH team. The winning brand will also sit among past recipients including Peter Do, Chopova Lowena, and Jacquemus. Zomer Leonardo DressAll-In Level BootTorishéju Bloomers Red TartanChristian Louboutin Launches Eyewear CollectionCourtesy of LouboutinWho: Christian LouboutinWhat: New eyewear collectionWhere: Online at christianlouboutin.com and at Christian Louboutin stores and select retailersWhy: Iconic footwear brand Christian Louboutin has introduced a new category to its accessories portfolio. The brand’s first-ever eyewear collection is inspired by the designer’s signature shoe styles like the Miss Z and the So Kate, with black, red, and gold accents and bold, contemporary silhouettes. The assortment includes both sunglasses and optical styles, complete with anti-reflective coatings, glare reduction, and durability treatments.Christian Louboutin Square Acetate SunglassesChristian Louboutin Miss Z Metal Cat-Eye SunglassesChristian Louboutin Miss Z Acetate Aviator Sunglasses
html:
No April Fools’ Day jokes here: This month will be full of drops, collaborations, and openings that will set your spring wardrobe up for success. First up, Coach has announced a long-term partnership as the official handbag of the WNBA; plus, Staud and St. Regis’s new collaboration will put you in a tropical mood. For all the fashion news to know this April, we’ve got you covered, below.

Who: Coach and the WNBA

What: Official handbag partner of the league

Where: Online at coach.com

Why: Coach is now the official handbag of the WNBA. To kick off the multi-year partnership, WNBA rookies will walk the Orange Carpet presented by Coach. Focusing on highlighting outstanding athleticism and sportsmanship, the brand will spotlight five inspiring draftees. Beyond the draft, Coach will also collaborate on major league moments including Pride Month and All-Star Weekend.

Coach Tabby Shoulder Bag 26

Coach Chain Tabby Shoulder Bag

Coach Tabby Shoulder Bag 20

Dries Van Noten Opens Its First New York City Flagship

Who: Dries Van Noten

What: New flagship

Where: Soho, New York City

Why: Dries Van Noten has opened its first stand-alone New York store in the heart of Soho. The flagship is directly inspired by the Manhattan streets, blending fast-paced energy with house codes to craft an immersive narrative experience that features design pieces by Ben Storms and artwork by Simone Crestani. A full selection of womenswear, menswear, and accessories are available to shop at the boutique now.

Dries Van Noten Embellished Jacket

Dries Van Noten Silk Lace Top

Dries Van Noten Embellished Jacquard Skirt

Tory Burch Brought Back the Reva Ballerina Flats

Who: Tory Burch

What: Reva ballerina flat

Where: Online at ssense.com

Why: Landing straight from the spring/summer 2025 runway, Tory Burch is back with its iconic Reva ballerina flat. Much to the dismay of die-hard Tory fans, the shoe had previously been out of production since 2017. The hiatus inevitably rebuilt the style’s allure, and now, the flat is back with revamped beveled logo hardware and an all-new mule iteration.

Tory Burch Reva Ballerina Flats

Tory Burch Reva Ballerina Flats

Tory Burch Reva Backless Ballerina Flats

Staud Teamed Up With St. Regis on a Vacation-Themed Collaboration

Who: Staud

What: Collaboration with St. Regis Hotels & Resorts

Where: Online at stregisboutique.com and staud.clothing

Why: Your vacation wardrobe should help you look exactly how you feel. For its first hospitality partnership, Staud has teamed up with St. Regis Hotels & Resorts to create a collection that will always remind you of your time in the sand. The signature Tommy bag, Moon bag, Squillo tote, and Meyers crochet bucket hat have been reimagined in raffia and a new beaded print exclusive to St. Regis.

Staud x St. Regis Moon Tote

Staud x St. Regis Tommy Beaded Bag

Staud x St. Regis Squillo Raffia Tote

Anna Sui Is Staging an Archival Exhibition at the Phoenix Art Museum

Who: Anna Sui

What: “The World of Anna Sui” exhibition

Where: The Phoenix Art Museum in Phoenix

Why: Traveling all the way from the Fashion and Textile Museum in London, “The World of Anna Sui” is landing at the Phoenix Art Museum (PhxArt). Since her runway debut in 1991, Sui is easily recognizable for her runways filled with supermodels decked out in her signature new-grunge aesthetic. The exhibit showcases more than 100 ensembles, including contemporary seasons, personal archive pieces, and looks curated in partnership with the museum’s fashion collection.

Balenciaga and Scholl Revamp the Summer Mule

Who: Balenciaga and Scholl

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at balenciaga.com

Why: Comfort meets design in Balenciaga’s latest footwear collaboration with Scholl. Originally debuting on the brand’s fall/winter 2025 runway during Paris Fashion Week, each style blends Demna’s subtle subversions with Scholl’s orthopedic insoles. The collection includes a knee-high boot, a clog mule, and heeled and flat sandals that nod to the original 1956 Pescura design.

Balenciaga x Scholl Clog Mule

Balenciaga x Scholl Flat Sandal

Balenciaga x Scholl Sandal

Moda Operandi Brings a Curated Shopping Experience to Palm Beach

Who: Moda Operandi

What: Curated shopping experience

Where: The Brazilian Court Hotel in Palm Beach, Florida

Why: Moda Operandi is bringing its luxury shopping expertise to Palm Beach. Until April 12, you can shop a curated selection of the e-tailer’s brands at The Brazilian Court Hotel. The week of shopping will include exclusive edits from brands like Johanna Ortiz, Brandon Maxwell, Missoni, and more. Guests are also welcome to peruse a variety of immersive experiences featuring Maison d’Etto, Sauer Fine Jewelry, and TWP.

Johanna Ortiz Alcázar Natural Palm Mini Tote Bag

Missoni Knit Cover Up Mini Dress

Brandon Maxwell Gage Tailored Velvet Denim Jacket

Buccellati Stages a Milan Design Week Experience

Who: Buccellati

What: “Naturalia” exhibit

Where: Milan Design Week

Why: This Milan Design Week, enter Buccellati’s fantastical world of nature and craft. Formed in partnership with Balich Wonder Studio, “Naturalia” is an immersive experience that guides you through silver pieces from the brand’s Furry Animals, Nature, and Marina collections. Natural scenes have been seamlessly integrated with digital displays to highlight the complex craft of each piece.

Buccellati Three Vine Leaves

Buccellati Furry Hawk

Buccellati Charonia Tritonis Shell

Mercedes-Benz, Moncler, and Nigo Debut G-Class-Inspired Capsule Collection

Who: Mercedes-Benz x Moncler by Nigo

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at moncler.com

Why: Combining brand legacy with contemporary streetwear, Mercedes-Benz, Moncler, and Nigo have collaborated on capsule collection that honors the Kenzo creative director’s one-of-a-kind Project G-Class Past II Future art piece. The pieces, which are part of the Moncler Genius roster, are inspired by Nigo’s influential streetwear career. Dual-logo baseball caps, oversized graphic T-shirts, and old-school bomber jackets draw on classic ’90s hip-hop silhouettes. Starting April 18, customers will also have the chance to pre-order a Hot Wheels replica of the Project G-Class Past II Future car model from mattelcreations.com.

Moncler x Mercedes-Benz by Nigo T-Shirt

Moncler x Mercedes-Benz by Nigo Baseball Cap

Moncler x Mercedes-Benz by Nigo Anubis Packable Jacket

Marni and Hoka Release The Bondi B3LS Running Sneaker

Who: Marni and Hoka

What: Bondi B3LS Running Sneaker

Where: Online at Marni.com, Hoka.com, flagship boutiques, and select global retailers

Why: Marni and Hoka have teamed up to release this season’s coolest running sneaker that celebrates movement and style. The Bondi B3LS Running Sneaker combines Marni’s signature color play with Hoka’s powerful performance. Featuring a bold, monochromatic silhouette, the sneakers are available in red, blue, brown, and yellow.

Marni Yellow MARNI x HOKA Bondi B3LS Sneaker

Marni Red MARNI x HOKA Bondi B3LS Sneaker

Marni Blue MARNI x HOKA Bondi B3LS Sneaker

Duran Lantink Wins This Year's International Woolmark Prize

Who: Duran Lantink

What: International Woolmark Prize

Where: Milan, Italy

Why: Duran Lantink has been awarded this year’s International Woolmark Prize. Presented by Donatella Versace, the independent designer will receive a cash prize of $300,000 AUD (approximately $195,000). Lantink, who made waves this Paris Fashion Week with his viral breastplate runway look, is also reported to be Jean Paul Gaultier's next couture guest designer.

LVMH Announces 2025 Finalists

Who: Alainpaul, All-In, Francesco Murano, Soshiotsuki, Steve O Smith, Tolu Coker, Torishéju, and Zomer

What: LVMH announces eight finalists for the 2025 LVMH Prize

Where: Paris, France

Why: After months of deliberation, LVMH has announced the eight finalists for this year’s LVMH Prize. On July 3, the short-listed independent designers will present in front of the jury for a chance to secure a €400,000 endowment and tailored mentorship program led by the LVMH team. The winning brand will also sit among past recipients including Peter Do, Chopova Lowena, and Jacquemus.

Zomer Leonardo Dress

All-In Level Boot

Torishéju Bloomers Red Tartan

Christian Louboutin Launches Eyewear Collection

Who: Christian Louboutin

What: New eyewear collection

Where: Online at christianlouboutin.com and at Christian Louboutin stores and select retailers

Why: Iconic footwear brand Christian Louboutin has introduced a new category to its accessories portfolio. The brand’s first-ever eyewear collection is inspired by the designer’s signature shoe styles like the Miss Z and the So Kate, with black, red, and gold accents and bold, contemporary silhouettes. The assortment includes both sunglasses and optical styles, complete with anti-reflective coatings, glare reduction, and durability treatments.

Christian Louboutin Square Acetate Sunglasses

Christian Louboutin Miss Z Metal Cat-Eye Sunglasses

Christian Louboutin Miss Z Acetate Aviator Sunglasses
